title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 532/92 of 27 February 1992 on the supply of refined sunflower oil as food aid
header:
COMMISSION REGULATION (EEC) No 532/92  of 27 February 1992  on the supply of refined sunflower oil as food aid
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
Refined sunflower oil shall be mobilized in the Community, as Community food aid for supply to the recipient listed in the Annex, in accordance with Regulation (EEC) No 2200/87 and under the conditions set out in the Annex. Supplies shall be  awarded by the tendering procedure.
The successful tenderer is deemed to have noted and accepted all the general and specific conditions applicable. Any other condition or reservation included in his tender is deemed unwritten.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities. This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.

The radioactivity certificate must indicate the caesium-134 and -137 and iodine-131 levels.
The radioactivity certificate must be endorsed by an Egyptian embassy or consulate.
(4) In order not to overload the telex, tenderers are requested to provide, before the date and time laid down in point 20 of this Annex, evidence that the tendering security referred to in Article 7 (4) (a) of Regulation (EEC) No 2200/87 has been  lodged, preferably:
